javaslang.algebra

Interface CheckedMonad<T,M extends HigherKinded<?,M>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - component type of this checked monad
    M - placeholder for the type that implements this
    All Superinterfaces:
    CheckedFunctor<T>, HigherKinded<T,M>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Try<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Failure, Success

    public interface CheckedMonad<T,M extends HigherKinded<?,M>>
extends CheckedFunctor<T>, HigherKinded<T,M>
    Defines a CheckedMonad by generalizing the flatMap function.

    All instances of the CheckedMonad interface should obey the three control laws:

    • Left identity: unit(a).flatMap(f) ≡ f a
    • Right identity: m.flatMap(unit) ≡ m
    • Associativity: m.flatMap(f).flatMap(g) ≡ m.flatMap(x -> f.apply(x).flatMap(g)
    given
    • an object m of type HigherKinded<T, M>
    • an object a of type T
    • a constructor unit taking an a and producing an object of type M
    • a function f: T → M
    To read further about monads in Java please refer to What's Wrong in Java 8, Part IV: Monads.
    Since:
    1.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • flatMap

        <U,MONAD extends HigherKinded<U,M>> CheckedMonad<U,M> flatMap(Try.CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends MONAD> mapper)
        Returns the result of applying f to M's value of type T and returns a new M with value of type U.
        Type Parameters:
        U - component type of the resulting monad
        MONAD - placeholder for the monad type of component type U and container type M
        Parameters:
        mapper - a checked function that maps the monad value to a new monad instance
        Returns:
        a new CheckedMonad instance of component type U and container type M
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if mapper is null

      • flatten

        <U,MONAD extends HigherKinded<U,M>> CheckedMonad<U,M> flatten(Try.CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends MONAD> f)
        Flattens a nested, monadic structure using a function.

        A vivid example showing a simple container type: 

         
 // given a monad M<T>
 [a,[b,c],d].flatten( Match
    .when((M m) -> m)
    .when((T t) -> new M(t))
 ) = [a,b,c,d]
        Type Parameters:
        U - component type of the resulting Monad
        MONAD - Monad type
        Parameters:
        f - a function which maps elements of this monad to monads of the same kind
        Returns:
        A monadic structure containing flattened elements.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if f is null

        Checks, if an element exists such that the predicate holds.
